answerText: Saha ionization equation [accept Saha-Langmuir equation or Saha-Boltzmann equation][10] The Saha equation is used to model the ionization of these ionized gases, which are often confined within Tokamaks. Stars are made of this substance.
heading: Penn-ance |2012 | 5 | 20 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question: This equation is sometimes co-named for Langmuir or Boltzmann, and it contains a term of 2 over the third power of the thermal de Broglie wavelength. For 10 points each: [10] Name this equation which gives the proportion of atoms in a gas that have been ionized. It holds when coulomb screening is negligible, and its used to interpret star spectra.
